meanings.definition: Calm or send to sleep, typically with soothing sounds or movements.
meanings.sent1: The gentle rocking of the cradle helped lull the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The sound of rain on the roof can lull you into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent3: The soft music seemed to lull the cat into a deep nap.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the waves lulls me into a dreamlike state.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic motion of the train lulls passengers into relaxation.

meanings.definition: A temporary interval of quiet or lack of activity.
meanings.sent1: After the busy morning, there was a lull in the office chatter.
meanings.sent2: During the lull in the storm, we could hear birds chirping outside.
meanings.sent3: The sudden lull in the conversation made everyone look around awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: In the lull of the afternoon, the town seemed almost deserted.
meanings.sent5: The lull in the market activity allowed traders to take a short break.
